column4: Thank you, I have been searching Google for something like that on ubuntu.com
So I should be using the open-source ATI driver, which one is that? Is it just "ati"?
I have already tried that one as stated and I have display issues
I'll go have a read, thanks
I'm sorry but you keep pointing to me to things I have tried, I have tried "ati" (open-source ATI), "radeon" and "aiglx", "vesa" and "fglrx" (proprietary ATI)
I'll give them all another try
sorry i have ati Radeon using fglrx. no experience with "ati" driver  have you tried channel  #ati
The link you gave me says fglrx is the proprietary ATI driver so you are using the proprietary ATI driver
yes but mine is radeon 9600  the 7000 can't use those i don't think
Yes it says I can't use it
It also says I can't use fglrx
